DQ Rule Description: CustomerID must be unique in Customer table
ProductID must be unique in Product table
OrderID must be unique in Order_Details table
ListedPrice of the same product category should fall within ± 2 standard deviations
DiscountedPrice of the same product category should fall within ± 2 standard deviations
Total Quantity of sales per month should fall within ± 3 standard deviations
CustomerBirthDate should not be less than 18 years or more than 120 years from now
OrderDate cannot be a date in the future
DiscountedPrice cannot be a negative value
ListedPrice cannot be a negative value
Quantity cannot be a negative value

CustomerCity should be populated based on a pre-specfied list of strings ['Atlanta', 'Boston', 'Chicago', 'Dallas', 'Denver', 'Las Vegas', 'Los Angeles', 'Nashville', 'New York', 'Orlando', 'Philadelphia', 'Phoenix', 'Portland', 'Richmond', 'San Francisco', 'Seattle']

CustomerState should be populated based on a pre-specfied list of strings ['Arizona', 'California', 'Colorado', 'Florida', 'Georgia', 'Illinois', 'Massachusetts', 'Nevada', 'New York', 'Oregon', 'Pennsylvania', 'Tennessee', 'Texas', 'Virginia', 'Washington']
ProductCategory should be populated based on a pre-specfied list of strings ['Housekeeping', 'Office Supplies', 'Furnishings', 'Maintenance', 'Public Areas']
DiscountedPrice cannot be higher than ListedPrice for one specific product
CustomerCity should be consistent with CustomerState for one specfic customer
